alert.note: Alert for Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 3:35PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of New Hanover, southwestern Pender, eastern Brunswick and east central Columbus Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 334 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Phoenix, or near Leland, moving southeast at 25 mph. This storm will produce heavy rain and lightning. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Leland, Oak Island, Carolina Beach, Wrightsville Beach, Kure Beach, Caswell Beach, Bald Head Island, Snows Cut, South Masonboro Island, Ocean Crest Pier, Figure Eight Island, Yaupon Beach, North Masonboro Island, Boiling Spring Lakes, St. James, Southport, Northwest, Sandyfield and Hightsville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 407 and 416. Interstate 140 between mile markers 15 and 20. US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 26 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender
